item.title: Last week, digital asset investment products saw an outflow of $223 million, marking the first outflow in 15 weeks.
item.description: On August 4th, CoinShares released its most recent weekly report data. Digital asset investment products witnessed outflows for the first time in 15 weeks. By the end of this week, the total outflows reached $2.23 billion. The week began with an inflow of $8.83 billion, but this trend reversed in the latter part of the week. This might be due to the hawkish FOMC meeting and a series of better-than-expected U.S. economic data. Although the soft weekend employment data has dovish implications for the Fed, a general risk-off sentiment led to further outflows, with outflows exceeding $1 billion on Friday.Bitcoin bore the brunt of the negative sentiment impact, with outflows of $4.04 billion this week. Nevertheless, since the beginning of the year, inflows have remained strong, reaching $20 billion.Despite facing setbacks later in the week, Ethereum achieved net inflows for the 15th consecutive week, totaling $1.33 billion, indicating strong market optimism for the asset. item.title: Bitcoin Options Market Trading Volume Sees 'Explosive' Growth
item.description: On August 4th, as per a news release dispatched by Binance to CoinDesk, the aggregate trading volume of the BTC options market has witnessed a remarkable surge. It has escalated from $4.11 billion in 2020 to $138.76 billion in June 2025, signifying a growth of more than 3200%.Options are a category of derivative contracts that bestow upon the buyer the entitlement, yet not the obligation, to purchase or sell the underlying asset at a pre-determined price within or by a specific date. Among them, a Call Option confers the right to buy, indicating a bullish stance towards the market. Conversely, a Put Option offers downside protection.

item.title: Binance Opens Bitcoin 'Options Writing' Feature to All Users
item.description: On August 4th, according to CoinDesk, Binance announced on Monday that it is making Bitcoin "options writing" available to all users in order to meet the growing demand of retail investors for more strategic and complex trading tools.Options are a kind of derivative contract that grants the buyer the right to buy or sell the underlying asset at a predetermined price on or before a specific date. Among them, a Call Option provides the right to buy, indicating a bullish stance in the market, while a Put Option offers downside protection."Writing options" refers to selling Call or Put Options, which is similar to providing "insurance" for the upside or downside of the underlying asset. The seller of the option (that is, the writer) receives a premium as compensation for the upfront payment.

item.title: Two addresses recently deposited nearly 54,000 ETH into a CEX, with a total value of $189 million.
item.description: Update, August 4th: According to The Data Nerd, 30 minutes prior to this update, 23,321 ETH (approximately $82.64 million) was transferred from the Binance institutional custody platform Ceffu to Binance. 18 hours before this update, Abraxas Capital deposited 30,600 ETH (approximately $106.9 million) into Bitfinex.

item.title: Hyperliquid's July Revenue Surpasses $86 Million, Reaching an All-Time High
item.description: On August 4th, according to Dune Data, Hyperliquid's revenue in July exceeded $86 million, reaching $86,608,345 and hitting a historical high. Meanwhile, its annualized revenue exceeded $1.2 billion, also reaching a historical high. The cumulative total revenue of the platform has reached $404.24 million.BlockBeats Note: Annualized revenue refers to the method of converting revenue data from the current period into an estimated annual revenue.

item.title: Orderly Omnivault APY exceeds 28%, TVL Surpasses $6 Million
item.description: On August 4th, the liquidity infrastructure's product Omnivault TVL exceeded 6 million US dollars, with an APY of more than 28%. Previously, in April 2025, Orderly launched OmniVault, enabling DeFi users to act as liquidity providers (LPs) and earn passive income. OmniVault adopts a market-making strategy managed by a trusted institution, allowing LPs to deposit USDC and earn yield across multiple networks supported by Orderly. The income earned by LPs is guaranteed by the market maker Kronos.

item.title: Ethereum ICO Whale on the Verge of Ending Sell-off Cycle and Initiating Buying, Recently Withdrawn 13,600 ETH from CEX
item.description: On August 4th, based on the monitoring of on-chain analyst AI Auntie @ai_9684xtpa, the "ETH ICO Whale with 1 million ETH" has withdrawn 13,600 ETH (equivalent to 47 million US dollars) from exchanges in the past three weeks after a one-year continuous sell-off. The most recent withdrawal took place 15 minutes ago at an average price of $3456.It has been more than two years since the whale last accumulated ETH. As of now, the whale still holds 59,718 ETH on-chain, which is worth 210 million US dollars.
